intro: Appertiella hexandra, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, edible fig-like structure that develops from the female flowers. Appertiella hexandra is often found growing on rocky outcrops and is adapted to arid environments.
